replies.body: So I understand that League in NA is much larger than those in other servers such as mine (OCE), I wouldn't mind seeing the ability to play Draft Pick in Normal Games, especially for pre-thirty. Reason is that I want to relax, not play ranked sometimes, yet while I'm fine with it sometimes, there are many times when you are disadvantaged in blind pick. Ever thought of adding these changes into other servers later on in 2K17
There are so many picks that I want to take that require certain champions to not be picked (due to low mobility on most ADCs), which makes learning them in blind pick incredibly difficult.

> Rumble changes the core game experience. Pick and ban phase becomes about banning out specific team comps, strategies, and specific team members instead of just taking out champs that happen to be powerful (it’s infinitely more meaningful to ban out the opposing jungler because you did your homework than it is to ban Zed because he’s strong, and it’s satisfying to feel the respect when you get banned). Teams get coaches. You scout, scrim, and review tape.

^ This is what we need! But also likely what we will never get in normal ranked.
As long as there are powerhouse outliers like Zed and Yasuo, most elos cant afford to ban strategically. A half-decent Yasuo will almost always rip through opposition like well.. a sword through the wind. 

Lee sin will more often than not, be the more efficient jungler in all elo's. He is tanky enough to survive most things, but also has enough damage to make junglers like Kindred and Fiddlesticks not worth picking in solo queue. He has more mobility than almost all other junglers (not to mention all other champs) 

Increasing the number of bans will help for sure!, but it alone might not be enough. You need to cut down the tall poppies. For example: Lee sin has everything a jungler (and a champion) could want, he's mobile in and out of fights, he's a tank wth assassin like damage and can knockup the entire enemy team. So why does he need 350 movement speed?? It seems to unessecary for a champ thats already so powerful to have so many little extra things like this. Where Kindred, (whose entire job is to try and get to her marks QUICKER than the enemy, has only 325 ms) which makes jungling against a Lee near impossible.

This is not a crusade against Yasuo or Lee or whatever, but if you want strategic banning to come into normal ranked, you are going to need to cut down the tall poppies.

> Then there’s ranked: shit gets real, you have to focus on improving, pay attention to the current meta, and widen your champ pool. 

Really? While you definitely want to broaden your game knowledge and experience by playing different roles and champions in Normals, *reducing* your champion pool to master a few mains is **imo** the best way to climb the Ranked ladder.

Normally when you hit 30 (based on the admittedly not-so large number of friends i have unofficially coached into league) you will be playing max 3 champions well, but normally just one favourite. And in ranked its kindof assumed you know the general abilities of all...what? 115? 120?.... champsion, So its a HUGE gap in knowledge and skill.
So I would agree with rito here about widening your pool at 30, as thats normally when. Although, normally about 35 because all your IP will be spent on runes the moment you hit 30

Well if that's what rito believes, they haven't seen my group of peeps, I personally have 700+ normal games and only 19 ranked I think :P because of the way you have to master something to carry your games (or just work as a team, which dosen't happen much)

hey I just lost a ranked game 30- 42 and ended up losing 22 LP. however when I won a game 36 - 26 I gained only 12 LP. 35 -21 same deal. the margins of kills are similar yet the LP losses/gains are not the same.
while u might say its circumstantial what about 53 - 26 I only got 13 LP that game. I know u cant give my LP back but could you at least provide an explanation. thanks an avid fan
Margin of kills is irrelevant when determining LP gains. It's entirely decided by your MMR, and your gains/losses could be calculated before the game has even started.

I believe that would be due to your MMR (or possibly team MMR) in comparison to your opponents MMR (or possibly team MMR). For instance if you are gold and your team was comprised of all gold players and you lost to a team that was full of silver players you lose more LP. On the flip side if you are gold and your team was all gold and beat a team of all plats you get more LP. I could definitely be wrong on that but I believe that is the case.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} Then there’s ranked: shit gets real, you have to focus on improving, pay attention to the current meta, and widen your champ pool. Not really cause by the time you have got to ranked you will have a ton of champs aswell as improving goes you do that no matter what if ranked or normals and current meta things are not hard to find out what is and whats not
I look forward to hearing more, can't wait for ranked changes!
